isis.stitle: Body Builder Electrical Data Book - SINGLE REDUCTION AXLES: SPICER S100-S, S105-S, S135-S, S150-S - INSTALL - CARRIER INTO AXLE HOUSING

step1.para: Thoroughly clean the inside of the carrier housing and inspect the housing mounting surface for nicks and general cleanliness. Stone the surface if necessary to remove burrs or nicks.
Apply a 1/8 inch bead of Loctite 518 gasket eliminator onto the axle housing mounting flange and around each bolt hole ( Figure 32).

figure.caption: Figure 32. Apply Gasket Eliminator onto Axle Housing Mounting Flange and Around Each Bolt Hole

step1.para: Thread 2 studs into housing 180 degrees apart. This will eliminate rotation of carrier assembly after it makes contact with the gasket material.

Install carrier assembly into axle housing. Clean mounting bolts, coat with Loctite #277 (red) or equivalent, and install. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICANTS AND SEALERS in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual. Tighten evenly in a cross pattern to 100 to 120 ft-lbs. (135 to 163 Nm).
Allow one hour cure time for gasket material before adding hypoid gear lubricant.
Remove old axle flange gasket and clean mating surfaces of hub and axle flange.
Install the axle shafts to proper location. Refer to the TORQUE CHART for proper torque specifications of axle flange nuts.
Clean and install drain plug. Fill unit to proper level with hypoid gear lubricant.
